column4: for which no information is published ro no help given to kernel developers, etc.
ndiswrapper is a funny thing, makes sesne though
not played with it myself ;-)
I still need help with getting the plugdev // whatever, for pcmcia-attached-compactflash
or whatever the gnome-plugger or whatever is called
how odd, shouldn't do, unless something wrong with the SCSI emulation driver [?]
hrrrm... SCSI is better command-queueable interface etc... multitasking and dma friendly sortof commandset
sounds like you dont' have the necessary SDL drivers etc...
I want to know who knows what is going on with the ''automounting'' sytem provided, what is going on ?? -- which program/daemon supports attached removeable devices ??
e.g. those flash-memory-with-usb-cntrlr-frontend-things
hal notifies gnome-volume-manager via dbus of the attached device, and g-v-m mounts it using pmount
dd, so where/how do I debug tis system to see which parts are seeing what ?
hmm, might be that hal isn't exactly aware of pluggables like that
which, of course, would be a problem. But I don't know the internals. File a hal bug for starters with that info?
or; the kernel doesn't report that to the userspace as being a pluggable device
hrrrrrm , well , how to do I found out that ?
cat /sys/block/[device] /removable
/sys/block/hde/removable: "1"
well, at least that's ok then
yep
so, to my limited knowledge, the kernel side would seem to be ok; sorry, hal internals not for me, as said
